<header>
Kuwait Today Issue 1723, Seventy-First Year
Sunday, 26 Rajab 1446 AH - 26/1/2025 AD
</header>

Based on the Constitution,
- And on the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And on Amiri Decree No. 15 of 1959 regarding the Kuwaiti Nationality Law, and its amending laws,
- And upon the submission of the First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers,

We have decreed the following
## Article One

The Kuwaiti nationality shall be withdrawn from the below-mentioned individuals and from those who may have acquired it with them by dependency:

Submitted by: Al-Rabat Al-Maghribia General Trading and Contracting Co. (L.L.C.) <orig>شركة الرباط المغربية للتجارة العامة والمقاولات (ذ.م.م)</orig>.
Against: Armada for Website Design and Management Co. (L.L.C.) <orig>شركة أرمادا لتصميم وإدارة مواقع الانترنت (ذ.م.م)</orig>.

Head of the Bankruptcy Administration

In the name of His Highness the Amir of the State of Kuwait
Sheikh Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>

## Court of First Instance
### Decision
On Thursday, 16/1/2025, at the headquarters of the Bankruptcy Administration, with the membership of Mr. Ali Hassan Shams Al-Din <orig>علي حسن شمس الدين</orig>, the Bankruptcy Judge, and in the presence of Mr. Othman Adel Al-Siddi <orig>عثمان عادل الصدي</orig>, the Secretary.
In petition No. 12/2024 for bankruptcy declaration, registered under automated No. 240101800
Submitted by: Al-Rabat Al-Maghribia General Trading and Contracting Co. L.L.C. <orig>شركة الرباط المغربية للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م</orig>
Against: Armada for Website Design and Management Co. L.L.C. <orig>شركة ارمادا لتصميم وإدارة مواقع الانترنت ذ.م.م.</orig>
After reviewing the submitted papers and documents:
Whereas the petitioner submitted a bankruptcy petition to the Bankruptcy Administration on 11/1/2024 against the respondent, based on the judgment issued in case No. 4327/2019 Commercial/Plenary/19, as amended by appeals No. 1713 and 2050/2020 Commercial, issued on 29/9/2021, obligating the respondent to pay the petitioner the sum of two hundred eighteen thousand, five hundred twenty-eight Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينارا كويتيا</orig> and 350 fils, plus legal interest at a rate of 7% from the date the judgment became final until full and final settlement.
In execution of said judgment, the petitioner opened enforcement file No. 19083404, Capital Enforcement - Companies, and all enforcement procedures were taken. Consequently, the respondent paid a portion of the debt amounting to ninety-four thousand, four hundred ninety-two Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينارا كويتيا</orig> and 436 fils, leaving an outstanding balance of one hundred twenty-seven thousand, ninety-two Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينارا كويتيا</orig> and 509 fils, excluding legal interest. The respondent was notified to pay the remaining balance but failed to act, which prompted the petitioner to file the present petition seeking a declaration of bankruptcy against the respondent.
The petitioner appeared through its legal counsel and submitted three document portfolios containing the judgment in case No. 4327/2019 Commercial/Plenary/19 and its appeals No. 1713 and 2050/2020 Commercial, a statement of the enforcement file's history, a certificate of commercial register extract, the articles of incorporation of a limited liability company and its amendments, enforcement procedures, a notice to pay the amount, a list of the company's cases, and a letter from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> stating the unavailability of the respondent's financial statements.
The respondent appeared through its legal counsel and submitted two defense memoranda, concluding with a request to initiate preventive settlement procedures and to pay the debt in monthly installments. It also submitted two document portfolios containing the company's articles of incorporation, commercial license, commercial register, a list of cases filed against it, and financial statements for the years 2019, 2020, and 2021.
The Bankruptcy Administration decided to address the Bankruptcy Committee regarding the petition to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures. In implementation of this decision, the Bankruptcy Committee submitted its report, concluding with the opinion that the working capital deficit of Armada for Website Design and Management Co. L.L.C. <orig>شركة أرمادا لتصميم وإدارة مواقع الانترنت ذ.م.م.</orig>, according to the audited financial statements for the year ending December 31, 2021, amounted to 73,523 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينارا كويتيا</orig>. The net current assets amounted to 814,627 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينارا كويتيا</orig>, while total current liabilities amounted to 888,150 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينارا كويتيا</orig>. We were not provided with updated financial data for the years ending December 31, 2022, and 2023. Therefore, we cannot ascertain the company's financial position, financial performance, and cash flows with a reasonable degree of certainty to determine whether the debtor is capable of managing its business and bankruptcy estate. Consequently, we propose the appointment of a trustee from the list of licensed auditors at the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> for the specific task of inventorying the debtor's net assets, properties, and liabilities, and obtaining audited financial statements for the last two years. The report is to be submitted within a timeframe at the discretion of the Bankruptcy Judge. A preliminary fee for the trustee has been estimated at four thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> for 80 hours of work.
Based on the foregoing, and as stipulated in Article 29 of Law No. 71 of 2020 issuing the Bankruptcy Law: "The Bankruptcy Judge shall rule on the petition within ten days from the date of the deadlines set for responding to it, by issuing a decision to initiate preventive settlement, restructuring, or bankruptcy declaration procedures. In the decision, a provisional date for the suspension of payments shall be appointed. If the decision to initiate the procedures does not specify the date on which the debtor suspended payments, the date of issuance of the decision to initiate the procedures shall be considered the provisional date for the suspension of payments. If the decision to initiate the procedures is issued after the debtor's death or retirement from business and the date of suspension of payments is not specified, the date of death or retirement from business shall be considered the provisional date for the suspension of payments."
And as stipulated in Article 33 of the same law, "The Bankruptcy Administration shall

Versus / National Company for Infrastructure Projects Development <orig>الشركة الوطنية لتطوير مشروعات البنية التحتية</orig>
Head of the Bankruptcy Department <orig>رئيس إدارة الإفلاس</orig>

In the name of His Highness the Amir of Kuwait
Sheikh Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>
Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>
Bankruptcy Circuit / 2

In the session held publicly at the court on Monday, 13/1/2025 G.
Presided over by Mr. Othman Al-Kandari <orig>عثمان الكندري</orig>, Court Deputy <orig>وكيل المحكمة</orig>
With the membership of Mr. Abdullah Al-Othman <orig>عبدالله العثمان</orig>, Court Deputy <orig>وكيل المحكمة</orig>
And the membership of Mr. Omar Al-Attal <orig>عمر العتال</orig>, Court Deputy <orig>وكيل المحكمة</orig>
And in the presence of Mr. Khaled Al-Qaisi <orig>خالد القيسي</orig>, Session Clerk <orig>أمين سر الجلسة</orig>
The following judgment was issued)
In Case No. (15/2024) Bankruptcy Circuit / 2
Automated No.: (241827090)

**Filed by:**
1- Mada Communications Company <orig>شركة مدى للاتصالات</orig>.
2- Middle East Telecommunications Company for Wired and Wireless Devices <orig>شركة الشرق الأوسط لأجهزة الاتصالات السلكية واللاسلكية</orig>.
3- Refrigeration and Oxygen Company Limited <orig>شركة التبريد والأكسجين المحدودة</orig>.
4- Mobile Telecommunications Company (Zain) <orig>شركة الاتصالات المتنقلة (زين)</orig>.

**Versus:**
1- National Company for Infrastructure Projects Development <orig>الشركة الوطنية لتطوير مشروعات البنية التحتية</orig> – formerly Kharafi National Company <orig>شركة الخرافي ناشيونال سابقا</orig> –.
2- Trustees in Bankruptcy <orig>أمناء التفليسة</orig> / Faleh Rashed Al-Azmi <orig>فالح راشد العازمي</orig> and Nasser Khalif Al-Anzi <orig>ناصر خليف العنزي</orig>.

## (The Reasons)

After hearing the oral arguments and reviewing the legally circulated papers:
Whereas the facts of the case, as established by its papers and documents, are that the four plaintiffs submitted to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> applications Nos. 140, 144, 145, 148 / 2023, with the first application submitted on 6/8/2023, requesting the initiation of bankruptcy declaration procedures against the first defendant due to its suspension of payment of the debt owed to each of the plaintiffs and the deficit in its financial position <orig>المركز المالي</orig>.
On the grounds that the first defendant owes the plaintiffs sums of money by virtue of final judicial rulings, and those companies initiated enforcement within ten days from the date of the Bankruptcy Judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision to commence, reject, or dismiss the procedures by publishing the decision, announcing it, and notifying the concerned parties thereof.. "

And as stipulated in the text of Article 34 of the same law, "If the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decides to accept the initiation of restructuring or bankruptcy declaration procedures, he shall, in the same decision, appoint the trustee nominated by the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> and whose fees have been estimated in accordance with the provisions of this law.. ".
And the text in Article 131 of the same law states, "The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall issue his decision to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures if the following conditions are met: 1- The debtor has suspended payments. 2- There is a deficit in the debtor's financial position <orig>المركز المالي</orig>. 3- The debtor's business is not viable for continuation".
Guided by the foregoing, and since it is evident from the application's papers and documents that the respondent's status as a merchant is established and that the bankruptcy declaration request has met the legally prescribed conditions for initiating bankruptcy declaration procedures, it has therefore been decided to accept the present application and initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures against the respondent, setting the application submission date as the provisional date for the suspension of payments, and appointing a trustee from the register of licensed auditors <orig>مراقبي الحسابات</orig> at the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> to inventory its assets and properties, prepare an updated financial position, a list of debts, and a plan for liquidation and distribution, and to take all necessary precautionary measures, with the decision to be published in the Official Gazette, announced, and the concerned parties notified thereof.

## Therefore, We Have Decided the Following:

1- To accept the application and initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures against the respondent, Armada for Website Design and Management W.L.L. <orig>شركة ارمادا لتصميم وادارة مواقع الانترنت ذ.م.م</orig>, and to set the application submission date of 11/1/2024 as the provisional date for the suspension of payments.
2- To appoint Ms. Rabia Saad Mounir Al-Muhanna <orig>رابعه سعد منير المهنا</orig>, registered in the list of licensed auditors <orig>مراقبي الحسابات</orig> at the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>, as a trustee to inventory the assets and properties of the debtor – the respondent – prepare an updated financial position, a list of debts, and a plan for liquidation and distribution, and to take all necessary precautionary measures to urgently verify the financial data and previous financial transactions of the management, and to obtain the audited financial statements for the last two years, with the report to be submitted within a suitable timeframe, and to estimate preliminary fees for the trustee in the amount of four thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> for 80 hours of work.
3- The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall publish the decision in the Official Gazette, announce it, and notify the concerned parties thereof.

Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>
Clerk

In accordance with Article (8) of the Bankruptcy Law, decisions issued by the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall be considered enforceable instruments <orig>سندات تنفيذية</orig> under this law. The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall affix the writ of execution <orig>الصيغة التنفيذية</orig> to them, and they shall be enforceable immediately upon issuance and without notification.

the judgments issued against it, as it is indebted to the first plaintiff in the amount of (97,830.710) in addition to the adjudicated legal interest. It is also indebted to the second plaintiff in the amount of (18,031.250 K.D.) in addition to the adjudicated legal interest. It is also indebted to the third plaintiff in the amount of (41,282.450 K.D.), and it is indebted to the fourth plaintiff in the amount of (415,701.459 K.D.) in addition to the adjudicated legal interest.
The court reviewed the case file and the procedures undertaken by the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>. The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> addressed the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> regarding the petitions to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures and their attachments. The Committee's response concerning the four petitions came in a report concluding that it was impossible to study and prepare a report on the debtor due to the lack of any data on the debtor's situation or audited financial statements for the company for the last three years. The Committee proposed appointing a trustee from the list of licensed auditors at the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> to inventory the debtor's assets and properties and to take all necessary precautionary measures urgently. Furthermore, the agent for the first defendant appeared and submitted four memoranda arguing for the inadmissibility of the petitions due to the absence of the legally stipulated notification and documents, and alternatively, for the rejection of the petitions for failure to meet the substantive conditions for bankruptcy declaration. Consequently, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decided to consolidate petitions Nos. (140, 144, 145, 148/2023) to proceed with them jointly, in accordance with the provision of Article (17) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>. Then, the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued his decision dated 19/2/2024, accepting the petitions, initiating the bankruptcy declaration procedures for the first defendant, setting the date of submission of the petitions, 6/8/2023, as the provisional date of cessation of payments, and appointing two trustees registered on the list of licensed auditors at the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> to inventory the assets and properties of the respondent, prepare an updated financial position, a list of debts, a plan for liquidation and distribution, and take all necessary precautionary measures for that purpose. The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> also issued decisions on 6/5/2024 and 9/5/2024 appointing inspectors to perform the mission stated in the operative part of those decisions, which are referred to herein to avoid repetition. The petition was then referred to this circuit by a decision from the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الافلاس</orig> and was registered with its number.
During the trial sessions, the four plaintiffs appeared through their agent, who submitted two defense memoranda, concluding with a request for a judgment declaring the first defendant bankrupt and appointing an employee from the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> to place seals on the first defendant's premises, offices, warehouses, books, papers, and movables, to draw up a report thereof, place seals on it, and deliver it to the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>. He also submitted three document portfolios on behalf of the first, third, and fourth plaintiffs, the most important of which contained copies of the judicial rulings underpinning the petitions.
The two bankruptcy trustees also appeared in person and submitted three memoranda on their most important actions in managing the bankruptcy, chief among them being the approval of the provisional list of debts, which totaled 244,484,924.222 K.D., and a list of bank guarantees and letters of guarantee totaling 22,008,980.801 K.D. They also submitted three document portfolios, the most important of which contained the minutes of the general assemblies for the financial years from 31/12/2017 to 31/12/2022.
The legal representative of Mashreq Bank <orig>بنك المشرق</orig> also appeared through his agent and submitted a statement of intervention to join the plaintiffs in their petitions, for which the fee was not paid. He also submitted a document portfolio, the most important of which contained a copy of the judgment in Appeals Nos. 6895 and 7306/2021 Commercial/19, which ordered the first defendant to pay him the amount of 3,082,502.128 K.D. and contractual interest at a rate of 9.99% every three months, effective from 2/2021 until full settlement.
Aydal National General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة أيدل الوطنية للتجارة العامة و المقاولات</orig> also appeared through its agent and requested the registration of the first defendant's debt to it in the list of debts. It submitted an unsorted document consisting of a request addressed to the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> to register the first defendant's debt to it in the list of debts, attached with documents, the most important of which was a copy of the judgment in Appeal No. 1527/2022 Commercial Appeal/2, which ordered the first defendant to pay it the amount of 32,177.175 K.D.
The court then decided to reserve the case for judgment at today's session.
Regarding the request of the legal representative of Mashreq Bank <orig>بنك المشرق</orig> to intervene in support of the plaintiffs in their petitions, the court refers to the provision of Article 87 of the Law of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>, which states that "Any interested party may intervene in the lawsuit, either joining one of the litigants or seeking a judgment for themselves on a matter related to the lawsuit. This shall be done through the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit before the day of the session, or by an oral request made during the session in the presence of the litigants and recorded in its minutes."
It also refers to the text of Article 23 of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>, which states that "With the exception of petitions submitted by regulatory bodies, the petitioner must deposit with the court treasury a sum of money or a bank guarantee, the value of which is determined by the executive regulations, based on the total debts or assets of the debtor on the date of submitting the petition, or the total debts of the creditor petitioner if the petition is submitted by a creditor. The head of the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> may decide on the deposit of a lesser amount as he deems appropriate in this regard.
The deposit shall be made in the manner and on the date determined by the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, and the deposited amount or guarantee shall be used to cover the expenses and costs of the preliminary procedures for making a decision on the petition.
The head of the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> may postpone the deposit of the aforementioned amount or guarantee if the petitioner is the debtor and does not have the necessary liquidity for the deposit on the date of submitting the petition, or if the preliminary procedures will not require any costs.
The executive regulations shall specify the judicial fees due for petitions, lawsuits, grievances, and appeals submitted pursuant to this law, and the party responsible for paying them."
<page_end>30</page_end>

In view of the foregoing, and as it is clear that the payment of the fee for a bankruptcy declaration request is one of the customary procedures for filing a lawsuit, and as the legal representative of Mashreq Bank <orig>بنك المشرق</orig> submitted a request for joinder intervention without paying the prescribed fee for filing the lawsuit, the intervention request has therefore not fulfilled the prescribed procedures, and the court rules it inadmissible, contenting itself with stating this in the reasoning without including it in the operative part of the judgment.

Regarding the request by Ideal National General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة أيدل الوطنية للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> to register the debt owed to it by the first defendant in the list of debts, the court refers to the established jurisprudence of the Court of Cassation that "The determining factor in classifying an intervention is its true legal characterization, not the description given to it by the litigants. An offensive intervention in a lawsuit is one in which the intervenor claims a personal right and seeks a judgment in their own favor. For it to be accepted, in addition to the requirement of interest, it must be closely related to the original claim, such that the proper administration of justice necessitates their joint consideration."

## (Appeal No. 3/2014 Administrative, session of 19/6/2014)

In view of the foregoing, and as the plaintiffs' claims in the lawsuit are for a judgment declaring the first defendant bankrupt, and the request of Ideal National General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة أيدل الوطنية للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> is to register the debt owed to it by the first defendant in the list of debts, and since this request is subject to different procedures than a bankruptcy declaration request, in addition to the request not being related to the plaintiffs' claims, as well as the non-payment of the prescribed fee, the court, based on all of the above, rules the intervention of Ideal National General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة أيدل الوطنية للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> inadmissible, contenting itself with stating this in the reasoning without including it in the operative part of the judgment.

Regarding the plea raised by the first defendant before the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> for the inadmissibility of the requests due to the absence of the legally stipulated notification and documents, it is unfounded. The court refers to the text of Article (31) of the Bankruptcy Law, which states that "The bankruptcy judge shall issue a decision not to accept the request if the documents and data stipulated in Article (20/1) of this law are not submitted, or if they are submitted incomplete without justification, unless the judge decides to accept the request under conditions deemed appropriate." It is also established in the jurisprudence of the Court of Cassation that "The text of Article (19) of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law, which states that 'A procedure shall be void if the law stipulates its nullity or if it is marred by a substantial defect that causes harm to the litigant, and nullity shall not be ruled despite being stipulated if the procedure does not result in harm to the litigant,' indicates that the harm considered in this regard is procedural harm, i.e., the loss of the interest that the law intends to achieve through the formality, or the undermining of the guarantee that the formality provides to the litigant. This is because the formality is merely a means to achieve an end that is fulfilled by its presence. If the end that the law intended to achieve for the litigant through the procedural formality is realized despite the formal violation, then the interest that the law intended to preserve and protect for the litigant through its requirement, in which the violation occurred, has been fulfilled, thereby negating the harm in the aforementioned sense."

## (Appeal No. 86/1997 Civil – session of 20/1/1998)

Therefore, and since the purpose of notifying the debtor of the need to pay the debt due within one month from the date of notification, in accordance with the text of Article (14) of the Bankruptcy Law, is for the debtor to voluntarily initiate payment, and as it is established from reviewing the request papers and its documents that the applicant companies have taken enforcement measures against the first defendant through the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> by virtue of enforceable judicial rulings, and the papers are devoid of any evidence that the first defendant has paid the debts due to date, and that the first defendant was represented by its agent before the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> in the present requests and submitted its memoranda with its pleas and defense, which implies that the purpose of the notification has been achieved, demonstrating its awareness of the lawsuit and negating any harm to it, and since the data, information, and attached documents of the requests are sufficient to rule on them, the first defendant's plea is therefore unfounded. The court disregards it and contents itself with stating this in the reasoning without including it in the operative part of the judgment.

Regarding the subject matter of the lawsuit and the plaintiffs' request therein to declare the first defendant bankrupt, it is stipulated by the text of Article 1 of Bankruptcy Law No. 71 of 2020, which states that for the application of the provisions of this law, the following words and phrases shall have the meaning assigned to each... Financial Deficit: The debtor's assets are insufficient to pay their debts.

Article 2 of the same law also stipulates that "The provisions of this law shall apply to: 1- Every natural person who has the status of a merchant. 2- Kuwaiti companies.....".

Article 131 of the same law also stipulates that "... The bankruptcy judge shall issue a decision to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures if the following conditions are met: 1- The debtor has ceased payment. 2- There is a deficit in the debtor's financial position. 3- The debtor's business is not viable."

Article 132 of the same law also stipulates that "In all cases where the bankruptcy judge issues a decision to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures, the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall refer the file of the request to initiate procedures to the Bankruptcy Court <orig>محكمة الإفلاس</orig> within ten days from the date of the bankruptcy judge's decision to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures. A report shall be filed with the file detailing the procedures taken on the request from its submission until the issuance of the decision to initiate the procedures, along with a statement of the factual and legal grounds for the decision."

It is established, as per the jurisprudence of the Court of Cassation, "that the trial court has full authority to examine the evidence and documents submitted to it, to weigh what it finds convincing among them, to deduce what it considers to be the facts of the case, and its assessment thereof and determination of its sufficiency for conviction are its sole prerogative, provided that this assessment is reasonable and does not deviate from what is established in the case file... "

## (Appeals 555, 599/2005 Commercial, session of 8/10/2006)

Based on the foregoing and guided by it, and as the plaintiffs' objective in their lawsuit is to obtain a judgment declaring the first defendant bankrupt due to its cessation of payment of the debt owed to the plaintiffs, and as it is legally established that for a court to declare a debtor bankrupt, the presence of

Regarding the plaintiffs' request to appoint an employee from the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> to place seals on the first defendant's premises, offices, warehouses, books, papers, and movables, to draw up a report thereof, to place seals on it, and to deliver it to the bankruptcy judge, the court refers to the text of Article 132 of the Bankruptcy Law, which states: "In all cases where the bankruptcy judge issues a decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures, the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall refer the file of the application to commence the procedures to the Bankruptcy Court within ten days from the date of the bankruptcy judge's decision to commence the bankruptcy declaration procedures. A report shall be filed with the file detailing the procedures taken on the application from its submission until the issuance of the decision to commence the procedures, along with a statement of the factual and legal grounds for the decision."

Based on the foregoing, and since the jurisdiction of the Bankruptcy Court is limited to declaring bankruptcy or not, without taking enforcement measures, the plaintiffs' request falls outside the jurisdiction of the Bankruptcy Court. The court therefore rules that it lacks jurisdiction to hear the request, as will be stated in the operative part.

As for the costs, including attorney's fees, the court orders the first defendant to bear them, in accordance with the provisions of Article 119/1 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure and Article 23 of the Bankruptcy Law.

(For these reasons)

### The Court has ruled:–
First: To declare the bankruptcy of the first defendant, the National Company for Infrastructure Projects Development – formerly Al-Kharafi National Company <orig>شركة الخرافي ناشيونال</orig> –, and to set 6/8/2023 as the provisional date of cessation of payments. The Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall register this judgment in the Commercial Register and publish a summary thereof in the Official Gazette in accordance with the procedures followed in this regard, and to add the costs and the sum of ten dinars for attorney's fees to the bankruptcy estate's liabilities.

Second: That the court lacks jurisdiction to hear the plaintiffs' second request.

Clerk of the Court
Presiding Judge

## Decision
On Thursday, 16/1/2025, at the headquarters of the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>
With the membership of Mr. Ali Hassan Shams Al-Din <orig>على حسن شمس الدين</orig>, Bankruptcy Judge
And in the presence of Mr. Othman Adel Al-Siddi <orig>عثمان عادل الصدي</orig>, Clerk
In Application No: 53/2024 Bankruptcy Declaration
Registered under automated No: 241875160
Submitted by /
1- Mohammed Eid Mohammed Al-Ajmi <orig>محمد عيد محمد العجمي</orig>.
2- Nasser Mubarak Eid Mohammed <orig>ناصر مبارك عيد محمد</orig>.
Against/ Daij Khalifa Talal Al-Jeri <orig>دعيج خليفه طلال الجري</orig>.
After reviewing the submitted papers and documents:
The applicants submitted a request to the Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> on 23/5/2024 to declare the bankruptcy of the respondent, on the grounds that, based on the debt acknowledgment and official undertaking to pay No. 21047/2017 issued by the Documentation Department of the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التوثيق وزارة العدل</orig>, it is established that the respondent acknowledged being indebted to the first applicant in the amount of fifty-five thousand six hundred and twenty-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, which represents the full entitlement of the creditor under all usufruct contracts concluded between them, and requested that this acknowledgment be appended with the executory formula. Similarly, based on the debt acknowledgment and official undertaking to pay No. 21039/2017 issued by the Documentation Department of the Ministry of Justice, it is established that the respondent acknowledged being indebted to the second applicant in the amount of one hundred and one thousand two hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, which represents the full entitlement of the creditor under all usufruct contracts concluded between them, with the amount to be paid on 31/12/2017, and requested that this acknowledgment be appended with the executory formula.
The creditors demanded payment of the outstanding financial amounts from the debtor under the two debt acknowledgments, but all amicable attempts failed, which prompted them to file the bankruptcy declaration application and take all necessary measures

The two applicants appeared in person and submitted unsorted documents consisting of the two aforementioned acknowledgments of debt bearing the executory formula, as well as two assignment contracts, two contracts for the sale of usufruct rights, two contracts for the management of usufruct rights, two commitment contracts, and a request to purchase usufruct rights. They also submitted a notice to pay the amount and a notice of intent to file for bankruptcy. Finally, they submitted statements of cases and attachments related to the respondent.

The respondent appeared through his legal counsel and submitted a memorandum—which we have reviewed—requesting in its conclusion, first: to exempt the respondent from submitting the documents specified in Article 20 of the Bankruptcy Law, and second: to reject the bankruptcy petition. He also submitted three document portfolios, the most important of which contained the two aforementioned acknowledgments of debt and the same contracts submitted by the applicants, in addition to payment vouchers and checks. Finally, within the portfolios, he submitted contracts concluded with other individuals.

The Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> decided to address the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> regarding the petition to commence bankruptcy proceedings. In implementation of this decision, the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> submitted its report, concluding with the opinion that it was unable to study and prepare a report assessing the financial situation of the debtor against whom the petition was filed, due to the lack of any financial data to ascertain his financial position. We propose the appointment of a trustee <orig>أمين</orig> from the list of auditors licensed by the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> to inventory the debtor's assets and properties and to take all necessary precautionary measures urgently. The trustee's <orig>أمين</orig> fees are then to be estimated based on 40 hours at a rate of 50 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> per hour, for a total amount of two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.

The respondent appeared through his legal counsel and was provided with a copy of the Bankruptcy Committee's <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> report, but he did not respond to it.

Based on the foregoing, and as stipulated in the text of Article 29 of Law No. 71 of 2020 issuing the Bankruptcy Law: "The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall rule on the petition, within ten days from the date of the deadlines set for responding to it, by issuing his decision to commence preventive settlement <orig>التسوية الوقائية</orig>, restructuring <orig>إعادة الهيكلة</orig>, or bankruptcy declaration <orig>شهر الإفلاس</orig> proceedings, and shall specify in his decision a provisional date for the suspension of payments <orig>التوقف عن الدفع</orig>. If the decision to commence proceedings does not specify the date on which the debtor suspended payments, the date of issuance of the decision to commence proceedings shall be considered the provisional date for the suspension of payments <orig>التوقف عن الدفع</orig>. If the decision to commence proceedings is issued after the debtor's death or after his retirement from commerce and a date for the suspension of payments is not specified, the date of death or retirement from commerce shall be considered the provisional date for the suspension of payments <orig>التوقف عن الدفع</orig>."

And as stipulated in the text of Article 33 of the same law: "The Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall, within ten days from the date of issuance of the Bankruptcy Judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision to commence, reject, or dismiss the proceedings, publish, announce, and notify the concerned parties of the decision..."

And as stipulated in the text of Article 34 of the same law: "If the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decides to accept the commencement of restructuring <orig>إعادة الهيكلة</orig> or bankruptcy declaration <orig>شهر الإفلاس</orig> proceedings, he shall, in the same decision, appoint the trustee <orig>أمين</orig> nominated by the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> and whose fees have been estimated in accordance with the provisions of this law..."

And the text in Article 131 of the same law: "...The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall issue his decision to commence bankruptcy declaration <orig>شهر الإفلاس</orig> proceedings if the following conditions are met: 1- The debtor has suspended payments. 2- There is a deficit in the debtor's financial position. 3- The debtor's business is not viable."

Guided by the foregoing, and since it is evident from the petition's papers and documents that the respondent's status as a merchant is established and that the bankruptcy petition meets the legally prescribed conditions for commencing bankruptcy declaration <orig>شهر الإفلاس</orig> proceedings, it is therefore decided to accept the present petition and commence bankruptcy declaration <orig>شهر إفلاس</orig> proceedings against the respondent, to set the date of the petition's submission as the provisional date for the suspension of payments <orig>التوقف عن الدفع</orig>, and to appoint a trustee <orig>أمين</orig> from the list of auditors licensed by the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> to inventory his assets and properties, prepare an updated financial statement and a list of debts, and a plan for liquidation and distribution, and to take all necessary precautionary measures for that purpose, with the decision to be published and announced in the Official Gazette and the concerned parties to be notified thereof.

Therefore, we have decided the following:

1- To accept the petition and commence bankruptcy declaration <orig>شهر إفلاس</orig> proceedings against the respondent, Duaij Khalifa Talal Al-Jeri <orig>دعيج خليفة طلال الجري</orig>, and to set the date of the petition's submission, 23/5/2024, as the provisional date for the suspension of payments <orig>التوقف عن الدفع</orig>.
2- To appoint Ms. Rabia Saad Muneer Al-Muhanna <orig>رابعه سعد منير المهنا</orig>, registered in the list of auditors licensed by the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>, as trustee <orig>أميناً</orig> to inventory the assets and properties of the debtor-respondent, prepare an updated financial statement and a list of debts, and a plan for liquidation and distribution, and to take all necessary precautionary measures for that purpose to urgently verify previous financial data and transactions, and to set the trustee's <orig>أمين</orig> fees based on 40 hours at a rate of fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> per hour, for a total amount of two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
3- The Bankruptcy Administration <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall publish and announce the decision in the Official Gazette and notify the concerned parties thereof.

Secretary
Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>

## Administrative Decision No. (5) of 2025
### Regarding the revocation of the license for the electronic media outlet named (4Sale Magazine)
The Assistant Undersecretary for the Affairs of the Press, Publishing, and Publications Sector <orig>وكيل الوزارة المساعد لشئون قطاع الصحافة والنشر والمطبوعات</orig>:
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (8) of 2016 regarding the Regulation of Electronic Media <orig>القانون رقم (8) لسنة 2016 بتنظيم الإعلام الإلكتروني</orig>,
- Ministerial Decision No. (100) of 2016 issuing the Executive Regulations for Law No. 8 of 2016 regarding the Regulation of Electronic Media,
- Administrative Decision No. (72) of 2022 regarding the revocation of the license for the bi-monthly "4Sale" media magazine.
- Administrative Decision No. 655 of 2022 regarding the delegation of certain powers,
- Electronic Media License No. 2021/481 issued on 15/8/2021,
- The letter from the Director of the Electronic Publishing Department <orig>مدير إدارة النشر الإلكتروني</orig> No. 8 dated 16/1/2025,
- And based on the public interest.

**Has Decided**

**Article One**
License No. 2021/481, issued in the name of the electronic media outlet "4Sale <orig>فورسيل</orig>", is hereby revoked by force of law, pursuant to Article (16), Clause 2 of Law No. 8 of 2016 regarding the Regulation of Electronic Media <orig>القانون رقم 8 لسنة 2016 بتنظيم الإعلام الإلكتروني</orig>.

**Article Two**

# Ministerial Decision No. (4) of 2025
## Concerning the Addition of Commercial Activities

**The Minister of Commerce and Industry,**
**Having reviewed:**
- Decree-Law No. (68) of 1980 issuing the Commercial Law, and its amending laws,
- And Law No. (111) of 2013 concerning commercial shop licenses, and its executive regulations,
- And Decree No. (191) of 2015 concerning the organization of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>,
- And Law No. (1) of 2016 issuing the Companies Law, its amending laws, and its executive regulations and their amendments,
- And Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig> Decision No. (285) dated 25/3/2012 concerning the recommendations of the Committee for the Unification of Commercial Classifications of Economic Activities in the State of Kuwait,
- And Ministerial Decision No. (689) of 2018 concerning the unification of the statistical data classification for economic activities in government agencies using the United Nations International Standard Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4, as internationally recommended by the United Nations Statistics Division and as agreed upon within the framework of the Gulf Cooperation Council countries,
- And Administrative Decision No. (461) of 2024 concerning the formation of the Committee for the Classification of Commercial, Professional, and Craft Activities,
- And the minutes of meeting No. (24) of the Committee for the Classification of Commercial, Professional, and Craft Activities, held on 4/12/2024, regarding the addition of new activities,
- And upon the submission of the Undersecretary of the Ministry <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig>,
- And based on the requirements of the public interest.

**Has decided**
**(Article One)**
The activity listed in the table attached to this decision shall be added to the commercial activities within the limits applicable in the Unified Guide for the Classification of Economic Activities in the Gulf Cooperation Council countries.

**(Article Two)**
All responsible officials, each within their jurisdiction, shall implement this decision. It shall come into effect from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

Minister of Commerce and Industry
Khalifa Abdullah Al-Ajil <orig>خليفة عبد الله العجيل</orig>

*   And upon the Decree issued on April 4, 1979, concerning the Civil Service System and its amendments.
*   And upon Amiri Decree No. (417) of 2010 issued on October 25, 2010, concerning the establishment of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig>.
*   And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (272) issued on October 3, 2012, concerning allowing Kuwaiti students to enroll for study outside the State of Kuwait only in universities for which a ministerial resolution is issued by the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig>.
*   And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (58) of 2013 concerning the adoption of the scholarship regulations of the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> and its amending resolutions.
*   And upon the decision of the Board of Directors of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig> No. (7) issued on December 31, 2014, which includes the mechanism for issuing resolutions related to identifying higher education institutions outside the State of Kuwait whose graduates' qualifications are permitted to be accredited.
*   And after reviewing the Bureau's Decision No. (9/2013) issued on June 2, 2013, which includes the rules and conditions for studying in universities and educational institutions in the United Kingdom, stipulating that study must be at the main campus and not at its branches, and at the same degree-granting university.
*   And upon the decision of the Board of Directors of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig> No. (5/2014) concerning the determination of criteria for selecting higher education institutions outside the State of Kuwait.
*   And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (40/2020) issued on February 17, 2020, concerning the updated list of higher education institutions in which enrollment is permitted for studying bachelor's and postgraduate programs in the United Kingdom.
*   And upon the decision of the Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research and Acting Minister of Education No. (284) issued on September 10, 2024, concerning the assignment of the task of determining the lists of distinguished universities for scholarship students and the National Excellence Program to the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig>.
*   And based on the recommendation of the Committee for Proposing Standards and Reviewing and Updating Lists of Higher Education Institutions Outside the State of Kuwait in its sixth meeting

### Article Four:
Study must be on a regular attendance basis during the academic week, and the academic program in which students enroll must follow the traditional education system.

### Article Five:
The academic program in which students enroll must have completed the specified duration for granting the academic degree, with the graduation of the first cohort from the college offering this program.

### Article Six:
Bachelor's, Master's, and Doctorate programs must not be executive programs.

### Article Seven:
The resolutions regulating enrollment and the system of study in higher education institutions outside the State of Kuwait must be observed. It must also be ensured that the academic degrees have met the requirements for their attainment in accordance with the regulating resolutions issued by the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> in the State of Kuwait.

### Article Eight:
Without prejudice to the provisions contained in the aforementioned scholarship regulations, students enrolled in the distinguished scholarship program under previous resolutions shall continue to receive the additional monthly stipend stipulated in Article (12) of the regulations.

### Article Nine:
This resolution shall come into force from its date of issuance, and any provision that contradicts its contents shall be repealed. It shall be published in the Official Gazette.

### Article Ten:
The competent authorities shall be informed and shall act accordingly.

Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research
Dr. Nader Abdullah Mohammed Al-Jalal <orig>د. نادر عبدالله محمد الجلال</orig>

Issued on: 16 Rajab 1446 H
Corresponding to: January 16, 2025 G

- And upon the Decree issued on April 4, 1979, concerning the Civil Service System and its amendments.
- And upon Amiri Decree No. (417) of 2010 issued on October 25, 2010, concerning the establishment of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig>.
- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (272) issued on October 3, 2012, concerning permitting Kuwaiti students to enroll for study outside the State of Kuwait only in universities for which a ministerial resolution is issued by the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig>.
- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (58) of 2013 concerning the adoption of the scholarship regulations of the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> and its amending resolutions.
- And upon the decision of the Board of Directors of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig> No. (7) issued on December 31, 2014, which includes the mechanism for issuing resolutions related to identifying higher education institutions outside the State of Kuwait whose graduates' qualifications are permitted for accreditation.
- And upon the decision of the Board of Directors of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig> No. (5/2014) concerning the determination of criteria for selecting higher education institutions outside the State of Kuwait.
- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (159/2020) issued on October 21, 2020, concerning the list of higher education institutions in the Kingdom of Norway in which enrollment is permitted for bachelor's and postgraduate studies.
- And upon the resolution of the Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research and Acting Minister of Education No. (284) issued on September 10, 2024, concerning the assignment of the task of determining the lists of distinguished universities for scholarship students and the National Excellence Program to the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig>.
- And based on the recommendation of the Committee for Proposing Standards and Reviewing and Updating Lists of Higher Education Institutions Outside the State of Kuwait in its sixteenth meeting held on October 28, 2024, and its seventeenth meeting held on November 11, 2024.
- And based on the approval of the Board of Directors of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig> in its twenty-seventh meeting held on October 31, 2024.
- And based on the presentation of the Director General <orig>المدير العام</orig> of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig>.

### Article Two:
The course of study must be on a regular attendance basis during the academic week, and the academic program in which students enroll must follow the traditional education system.

### Article Three:
The academic program in which students enroll must have completed the specified duration for awarding the academic degree, with the graduation of the first cohort from the college offering this program.

### Article Four:
Bachelor's, Master's, and Doctorate programs must not be executive programs.

### Article Five:
The resolutions regulating enrollment and the system of study in higher education institutions outside the State of Kuwait must be observed, and it must be ensured that the academic degrees have met the requirements for their attainment in accordance with the regulating resolutions issued by the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> in the State of Kuwait.

### Article Six:
Without prejudice to the provisions contained in the aforementioned scholarship regulations, students enrolled in the distinguished scholarship program under previous resolutions shall continue to receive the additional monthly stipend stipulated in Article (12) of the regulations.

### Article Seven:
This resolution shall come into effect from its date of issuance, and any provision that contradicts its contents shall be repealed. It shall be published in the Official Gazette.

### Article Eight:
The competent authorities shall be informed and shall act accordingly.

Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research
Dr. Nader Abdullah Mohammed Al-Jalal <orig>د. نادر عبدالله محمد الجلال</orig>

- And upon the Decree issued on April 4, 1979, concerning the Civil Service System and its amendments.
- And upon Amiri Decree No. (417) of 2010 issued on October 25, 2010, concerning the establishment of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig>.
- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (272) issued on October 3, 2012, concerning permitting Kuwaiti students to enroll for study outside the State of Kuwait only in universities for which a ministerial resolution is issued by the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig>.
- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (58) of 2013 concerning the adoption of the scholarship regulations of the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> and its amending resolutions.
- And upon the decision of the Board of Directors of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig> No. (7) issued on December 31, 2014, which includes the mechanism for issuing resolutions related to identifying higher education institutions outside the State of Kuwait whose graduates' qualifications are permitted for accreditation.
- And upon the decision of the Board of Directors of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig> No. (2014/5) concerning the determination of criteria for selecting higher education institutions outside the State of Kuwait.
- And upon Resolution No. (2013/18) issued on October 6, 2013, concerning permitting study in bachelor's and postgraduate programs in the Kingdom of the Netherlands.
- And upon the resolution of the Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research and Acting Minister of Education No. (284) issued on September 10, 2024, concerning the assignment of the task of determining the lists of distinguished universities for scholarship students and the National Excellence Program to the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig>.
- And based on the recommendation of the Committee for Proposing Standards and Reviewing and Updating Lists of Higher Education Institutions Outside the State of Kuwait in its sixteenth meeting held on October 28, 2024, and its seventeenth meeting held on November 11, 2024.
- And based on the approval of the Board of Directors of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig> in its twenty-seventh meeting held on October 31, 2024.
- And based on the presentation of the Director General <orig>المدير العام</orig> of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig>.
- And in accordance with the public interest.

## ( It is decided )

### Article One:
The lists of academic specializations in higher education institutions in the Kingdom of Norway, globally ranked by THE Times Higher Education, for the study of bachelor's and postgraduate programs are approved as follows:

<table_caption>Approved Specializations at the University of Oslo</table_caption>
<table>
| | Arts & Humanities |
|---|---|
| 1 | University of Oslo |
| | **Education** |
| 1 | University of Oslo |
| | **Law** |
| 1 | University of Oslo |
| | **Social Sciences** |
| 1 | University of Oslo |
</table>

### Article Two:
Study must be on a regular attendance basis during the academic week, and the academic program in which students enroll must follow the traditional education system.

### Article Three:
The academic program in which students enroll must have completed the specified duration for awarding the academic degree, with the graduation of the first cohort from the college offering this program.

### Article Four:
Bachelor's, Master's, and Doctoral programs must not be executive programs.

### Article Five:
The resolutions regulating enrollment and the system of study in higher education institutions outside the State of Kuwait must be observed, and it must be ensured that the academic degrees have met the requirements for their attainment in accordance with the regulating resolutions issued by the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> in the State of Kuwait.

### Article Six:
Without prejudice to the provisions contained in the aforementioned scholarship regulations, students enrolled in the distinguished scholarship program under previous resolutions shall continue to receive the additional monthly stipend stipulated in Article (12) of the regulations.

### Article Seven:
This resolution shall come into effect from its date of issuance, and any provision that contradicts its contents shall be repealed. It shall be published in the Official Gazette.

### Article Eight:
The competent authorities shall be notified and shall act accordingly.

Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research
Dr. Nader Abdullah Mohammed Al-Jalal <orig>د. نادر عبدالله محمد الجلال</orig>

Issued on: 16 Rajab 1446 H
Corresponding to: January 16, 2025 AD

- And upon the decision of the Board of Directors of the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation and Education Quality Assurance <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي وضمان جودة التعليم</orig> No. (5/2014) concerning the determination of criteria for selecting higher education institutions outside the State of Kuwait.

## Article Two:
The study must be on a regular attendance basis during the academic week, and the academic program in which the students enroll must follow the traditional education system.

## Article Three:
The academic program in which the students will enroll must have completed the specified duration of study for awarding the academic degree, with the graduation of the first cohort from the college offering this program.

## Article Four:
Bachelor's, Master's, and Doctorate programs must not be executive programs.

## Article Five:
The resolutions regulating enrollment and the system of study in higher education institutions outside the State of Kuwait must be observed, and it must be ensured that the academic degrees have met the requirements for their attainment in accordance with the regulating resolutions issued by the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> in the State of Kuwait.

## Article Six:
Without prejudice to the provisions contained in the aforementioned scholarship regulations, students enrolled in the distinguished scholarship program under previous resolutions shall continue to receive the additional monthly stipend stipulated in Article (12) of the regulations.

## Article Seven:
This resolution shall be effective from its date of issuance, and any provision that contradicts its contents shall be repealed. It shall be published in the Official Gazette.

## Article Eight:
The competent authorities shall be informed and shall act accordingly.

Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research

The academic program in which students enroll must have completed the specified duration for awarding the academic degree, with the graduation of the first cohort from the college offering this program.

**Article Four:**

Bachelor's, Master's, and Doctoral programs must not be executive programs.

**Article Five:**

The regulations governing enrollment and the system of study in higher education institutions outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> must be observed. It must also be ensured that academic degrees have met the requirements for their attainment in accordance with the relevant regulations issued by the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.

**Article Six:**

Without prejudice to the provisions contained in the aforementioned scholarship regulations, students enrolled in the distinguished scholarship program under previous decisions shall continue to receive the additional monthly stipend stipulated in Article (12) of the regulations.

**Article Seven:**

This decision shall take effect from its date of issuance, and any provision that contradicts its contents shall be repealed. It shall be published in the Official Gazette.

**Article Eight:**

The competent authorities shall be notified and shall act accordingly.

Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research
Dr. Nader Abdullah Mohammed Al-Jalal <orig>د. نادر عبدالله محمد الجلال</orig>

- And upon Decree-Law No. 41 of 1988 concerning the regulation of livestock grazing.
- And upon Law No. 42 of 2014 concerning environmental protection.
- And upon the Law of Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> No. 33 of 2016.
- And upon Resolution No. 110 of 1999 concerning the conditions and procedures for granting grazing licenses in accordance with the provisions of Decree-Law No. 41 of 1988.
- And upon Resolution No. 15 of 2008 transferring the jurisdiction for the application of Decree-Law No. 41 of 1988 and its implementing resolutions to the Licensing and Pastures Department.
- And upon the decision of the Board of Directors in session No. M.H.Z. 5/85/2024 dated 5/12/2024, approving the amendment of Resolution No. 110 of 1999 concerning the conditions and procedures for granting grazing licenses in accordance with the provisions of Decree-Law No. 41 of 1988, with the addition of a certificate of good conduct to the license application requirements.
- And upon the letter from the Cosmetic Agriculture Sector No. 5718 dated 30/10/2024 regarding the draft resolution.
- And as required by the public interest.

**It is decided**

## Article One
Article Two of Resolution No. 110 of 1999 concerning the conditions and procedures for granting grazing licenses in accordance with the provisions of Decree-Law No. 41 of 1988 shall be amended to read as follows:
"The granting of a grazing license is subject to the fulfillment of the following conditions: -
1- The license applicant must be of Kuwaiti nationality.
2- The license applicant must not be less than (21) twenty-one Gregorian years of age.
3- The applicant must submit a certificate of good conduct, and must not have been sentenced to a penalty restricting freedom for a crime against honor or trust, whether a felony or a misdemeanor.
4- The license applicant must own no fewer than (50) fifty head of sheep and goats, or either of them, or (5) five head of camels and cattle, or either of them.
5- A security deposit of (100 K.D.) only one hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> shall be paid to the Authority.
6- The grazing license shall be issued for a fee of (5 K.D.) only five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
7- The licensee is temporarily permitted to set up the following:
    - a- A mobile enclosure with an area not exceeding 10 square meters per head of sheep and an area not exceeding 25 square meters per head of camel.
    - b- A tent with an area not exceeding 5m x 8m.
    - c- A mobile prefabricated house with an area not exceeding 4m x 12m.
    - d- It is forbidden to erect or place any type of fence or earthen berms at the site permitted for grazing in accordance with the preceding requirements.
    - e- It is prohibited to erect any other temporary structures other than those specified in the preceding clauses.
    - f- The duration of the establishment of the aforementioned temporary structures and their locations shall be determined by the Authority.
    - g- The aforementioned temporary structures may not be erected without the initial approval of the Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> and the approval of the Authority.
    - h- A distance must be maintained from security and oil installations and nature reserves.
    - i- The Authority has the right to request the removal of the aforementioned permitted temporary structures at any time without objection from the licensee. In the event of non-removal, the Authority has the right to remove them at the licensee's expense.
    - j- In case of violation of the preceding clauses, the legal procedures stipulated in Decree-Law No. 41 of 1988 shall be taken, and the Authority has the right to administratively revoke the license.

## Article Two
All competent authorities shall implement this resolution, which shall come into effect from the date of its publication. Any provisions that contradict it are hereby repealed. It shall be published in the Official Gazette.

Director General <orig>المدير العام</orig>
Eng. Nasser Mohammed Taqi <orig>م. ناصر محمد تقي</orig>

Issued on: 16 January 2025 AD

Has decided the following:
## Article One
Securities House Company <orig>شركة بيت الأوراق المالية</orig> is licensed to privately market 150,000 shares (only one hundred fifty thousand shares) of EIB Investors Limited, a company established in the Cayman Islands, within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>. The offering price shall be 1,000 Euros (only one thousand Euros) per share, in addition to a 1% subscription commission payable once upon subscription.

## Article Two
The shares to be marketed within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> shall be offered to professional clients only, as stipulated in Book One (Definitions) of the Executive Bylaws of Law No. 7 of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, and their amendments. The entity receiving subscription applications shall be:
- Securities House Company <orig>شركة بيت الأوراق المالية</orig>.

## Article Three
The objectives of the collective investment scheme shall be determined based on the information provided in the prospectus.

## Article Four
The term of the marketing license is one year, renewable annually, starting from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate and after payment of the prescribed fees.

## Article Five
The prescribed fees shall be paid within one month from the date of issuance of this decision. In the event of failure to pay the fees within the specified period, the decision shall be considered null and void.

## Article Six
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

Head of the Supervision Sector

# Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig>
## Announcement
The Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig> announces Tender No. (11 / 2024 – 2025) concerning the supply and warranty of laptop computers and printers for the Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince (non-divisible). Specialized companies/institutions in this field should contact the Procurement and Contracts Department (Contracts and Tenders Section) at the Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince (Bayan Palace – Administrative Building – Third Floor – ZONE 5) to obtain the tender documents for a fee of (50 K.D.), only fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>, payable via (K-Net). Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from this fee, provided they submit proof thereof. They must bring a copy of the tender announcement from the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) and the following documents:
Registration receipt with the Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig> for the fiscal year (2024 – 2025). Or
1. A copy of the license from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
2. A copy of the Commercial Register.
3. A copy of the Civil ID for the establishment or company.
4. A copy of the company's Articles of Association (if any).
5. A copy of a valid registration certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
6. A copy of a valid registration certificate from the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig>.
7. A copy of a valid registration receipt from the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
8. A copy of the authorized signatory for the bidder.
9. A valid certificate from the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> regarding the national labor percentage.
10. An authorization letter from the company/institution for the person authorized to purchase the tender documents.

Please note that the closing date (deadline for submitting bids) is Monday, 10/02/2025, from (nine) o'clock in the morning until (one) o'clock in the afternoon. The bid must be submitted with a preliminary deposit in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee issued by a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait, in the name of the bidder and for the benefit of the Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig>.

### Article Two

- M/s. Al-Abdali Group Company (General Cargo Handling Contractor).

### Article Four

### Article Five
This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) and shall be effective as of 1/1/2025. The concerned authorities shall, each within its jurisdiction, take the necessary measures for its implementation.

Director General <orig>المدير العام</orig>

## Ministerial Decision No. (87 / 2024)

### Regarding the adoption of (2) amendments to Kuwaiti standard specifications and the adoption of an amendment to the year of issuance for (1) amendment to the Kuwaiti technical regulation "Permitted Food Additives"

### No. KWS GSO 2500:2023/Amd1:2024

The Minister of Commerce and Industry
Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>
Having reviewed,
- Law No. 43 of 1964 regarding importation and its executive regulations.
- Decree-Law No. 128 of 1977 concerning standardization.
- Law No. 56 of 1996 issuing the Industry Law, its executive regulations, and their amendments.
- Decree No. 191 of 2015 concerning the organization of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
- The relevant ministerial decisions concerning the adoption of the technical regulations and standard specifications contained in the appendix attached to this decision.
- The internal regulations approved by the Ministerial Committee for Codification Affairs on November 14, 2019, which replace the statute of the GCC Standardization Organization (GSO) for the Arab States of the Gulf.
- The decision of the Technical Council of the GCC Standardization Organization for the Arab States of the Gulf at its fifty-fourth meeting held on February 28, 2023.
- The decision of the Technical Council of the GCC Standardization Organization for the Arab States of the Gulf at its fifty-sixth meeting held during the period of September 10-11, 2023.
- Ministerial Decision No. 30 of 2023.
- The decision of the General Committee for Standardization at its seventy-second meeting held on July 30, 2024, Decision No. (4), Document No. (GCS/24/72/05).
- And upon the proposal of the Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>مدير عام الهيئة العامة للصناعة بالتكليف</orig>.
- And based on the public interest.

## Has decided

### Article One
The technical amendment to the Gulf standard specifications (numbering 2), as detailed in Appendix No. (1) of this decision, shall be considered an amendment to the Kuwaiti standard specifications.

### Article Two
The material error in the year of issuance for the technical amendment to the Kuwaiti technical regulation, adopted in Ministerial Decision No. 2023/30 and detailed in Appendix No. (2) of this decision, shall be corrected.

### Article Three
The provisions of Ministerial Decision 2023/30 regarding the adoption of (20) amendments and a typographical correction to the Gulf standard specifications and technical regulations, as an amendment and typographical correction to the Kuwaiti standard specifications and technical regulations, shall remain in effect, insofar as they do not conflict with the provisions of this decision.

### Article Four
Any technical regulations and standard specifications contained in previous decisions that conflict with this decision are hereby repealed.

### Article Five
All responsible officials, each within their jurisdiction, shall implement this decision, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Minister of Commerce and Industry
Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>
Khalifa Abdullah Al-Ajil <orig>خليفة عبد الله العجيل</orig>

## Ministerial Decision No. (92/2024)
## Regarding the adoption of (5) Gulf Technical Regulations as (Mandatory) Kuwaiti Technical Regulations

The Minister of Commerce and Industry
Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>
After reviewing...
- Law No. 43 of 1964 regarding importation and its executive regulations.
- Decree-Law No. 128 of 1977 concerning standardization.
- Law No. 56 of 1996 issuing the Industry Law, its executive regulations, and their amendments.
- Decree No. 191 of 2015 concerning the organization of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
- The internal regulations approved by the Ministerial Committee for Standardization Affairs <orig>اللجنة الوزارية لشؤون التقييس</orig> on November 14, 2019, which replace the statute of the GCC Standardization Organization (GSO) <orig>هيئة التقييس لدول مجلس التعاون لدول الخليج العربية</orig>.
- The relevant ministerial decisions concerning the adoption of Kuwaiti technical regulations and standard specifications that are to be updated with the technical regulations listed in the annex attached to this decision.
- The decision of the Ministerial Committee for Standardization Affairs <orig>اللجنة الوزارية لشؤون التقييس</orig> of the Gulf Cooperation Council at its sixth meeting held on September 14, 2023.
- The decision of the General Committee for Standardization <orig>اللجنة العامة للتوحيد القياسي</orig> at its seventy-second meeting held on July 30, 2024, Decision No. (5), Document No. (GCS/24/72/06).
- And upon the proposal of the Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>.
- And based on the requirements of the public interest.

**Has Decided**

### Article One
The Gulf Technical Regulations (5 in number), detailed in the annex to this decision, shall be considered (mandatory) Kuwaiti technical regulations.

### Article Two
The technical regulations and standard specifications contained in previous decisions that conflict with this decision are hereby repealed.

### Article Three
All responsible officials, each within their jurisdiction, shall implement this decision. It shall come into force six months after the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Minister of Commerce and Industry
Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Public Authority for Industry
Khalifa Abdullah Al-Ajil <orig>خليفة عبد الله العجيل</orig>

# Announcement
The Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> announces the offering of Tender No. W.K.M./55/2023/2024
Project for the construction and completion of the Ministry of Electricity and Water building in Sabah Al-Ahmad City <orig>مدينة صباح الأحمد</orig>
At the request of the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig>
Tender documents can be obtained from the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.

</table>

- The tender documents will be published on the Agency's website for review before proceeding to purchase the documents.
- The final time for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on the day specified in the announcement above for bid submission.
- Bidders and practitioners must adhere to the instructions for submitting and depositing bids on a CD, which are available on the Agency's website: WWW.CAPT.GOV.KW.
- The aforementioned fee is to be paid by a certified check or K-Net card.
- Companies/bidders wishing to submit inquiries, clarifications, etc., must submit them to the concerned entity at the time and place specified in the table above for the preliminary meeting (inquiry session). Any inquiries or clarifications submitted to the Agency will not be considered.
- All documents must be submitted on a non-copiable CD, with the exception of the bid form and the initial bid bond, which must be submitted as hard copies.
- Not divisible.
- A valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage, issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, must be submitted with the bid.
- The bidder must attach a valid "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there are no holds on the bidder's file for government contracts registered with the Authority due to any of the violations mentioned in Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 concerning work in the private sector. It should be noted that bids not including this certificate will be disqualified.

**Announcement**

The Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> announces the issuance of Tender No. MA/8/2024/2025
