# Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>
## Announcement
The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> announces the offering of Practice No. WA/2024/906 – 2025 for the supply of gift badges for the 2025 National Day celebrations, in accordance with the technical terms and specifications contained in the practice documents, which can be purchased from the Ministry of Information's website via the QR code attached to this announcement, starting from Sunday, 26/01/2025, for a non-refundable fee of (30 K.D.), only thirty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. Bids are to be submitted to the Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> at the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> in sealed envelopes, accompanied by an initial guarantee of (2%) of the bid value (which must be valid for the entire 90-day bid validity period). The practice number, as indicated above, must be written on the outside of the envelope, avoiding any mention of the practitioner's name or any identifying marks. The deadline for bid submission is 1:00 PM on Tuesday, 04/02/2025.

- All documents must be submitted on three (3) non-copiable CDs, with the exception of (the bid form, the initial guarantee, a copy of the purchase receipt, and the practitioner's data form).
- The practice is indivisible, and alternative offers will not be accepted.
- This announcement serves as an invitation for practitioners wishing to attend the envelope-opening session to do so, after coordinating with the Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> before the day scheduled for the bid-opening session.
- A valid certificate of national labor percentage compliance, issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, must be submitted with the bid. Please note that bids not including this certificate will be disqualified.
- The bidder must attach a valid "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there is no hold on the practitioner's file for government contracts registered with the Authority due to any of the violations mentioned in Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 concerning work in the private sector. Please note that bids not including this certificate will be disqualified.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from the fees for purchasing documents, in accordance with the provisions of Article 39 of Law No. 74/2019 regarding amendments to Law No. 49 of 2016.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises wishing to apply for the practice must attach to their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> certifying their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.
- This announcement is an integral part of the practice documents.

- To obtain a copy, the practitioner must register and pay the fees through the website:
- https://eservice.media.gov.kw/purchase

## Announcement
The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> announces the offering of Practice No. WA/2024/907-2025 concerning the supply of Iftar and Suhoor meals for Ministry of Information employees during the holy month of Ramadan, in accordance with the technical terms and specifications contained in the practice documents, which can be purchased via the Ministry of Information's website using the QR code attached to this announcement, starting from Sunday, 26/01/2025, for a non-refundable fee of (50 K.D.), only fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. Bids are to be submitted to the Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> at the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> – Al-Soor Street – Ground Floor, in sealed envelopes, accompanied by an initial guarantee of (2%) of the bid value (which must be valid for the entire 90-day bid validity period). The envelope must be sealed, and the practice number, as indicated above, must be written on the outside, avoiding any mention of the practitioner's name or any identifying marks. The deadline for bid submission is 1:00 PM on Sunday, 09/02/2025.

- The Ministry of Information will hold a preliminary meeting on Sunday, 02/02/2025, at 11:00 AM in the meeting hall of the Director of the General Services Department <orig>مدير إدارة الخدمات العامة</orig> – Shuwaikh Industrial 2 / Banks Street / General Services Department / Ministry of Information / Ground Floor, to answer inquiries regarding the practice. Anyone who has purchased the practice documents may attend the meeting in person or be represented. All that is recorded in the minutes of the meeting shall be considered an integral part of the practice documents and shall be binding on all bidders. The Ministry will circulate the questions, inquiries, and their answers after approval to all practitioners before the bid closing date.
- All documents must be submitted on three (3) non-copiable CDs, except for:# Ministry of Islamic Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الإسلامية</orig>

## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
### Held on Wednesday, January 08, 2025

The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of Arkan Al Kuwait Real Estate Co. K.S.C.P. <orig>شركة أركان الكويت العقارية ش. م. ك. عامة</orig> was held on Wednesday, January 08, at 10:30 AM at the headquarters located in the Sharq area – Block 8 – Al-Shuhada Street – Al Hamra Business Tower – 66th Floor, in the presence of:
1- Mr. Abdulrahman Hamad Al-Terkait <orig>عبدالرحمن حمد التركيت</orig>, Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chief Executive Officer – Chairman of the Assembly
2- Mr. Fahad Ali Al-Hudaib <orig>فهد علي الهديب</orig>, representing the Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig>
3- Shareholders holding 214,667,406 shares in person and by proxy, representing 85.474% of the total capital of 251,149,622 shares. After announcing that the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting was met, the Chairman of the Assembly opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees. The items on the agenda were then reviewed and discussed, and the following were approved and ratified:
1- The draft merger by amalgamation agreement between Arkan Al Kuwait Real Estate Co. (K.S.C.P.) <orig>شركة أركان الكويت العقارية (ش.م.ك.ع)</orig> and Al-Oula Real Estate Investment Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>الشركة الأولى للاستثمار العقاري (ش.م.ك.م)</orig> was ratified, along with the annexes to the draft merger agreement, including the asset valuator's report, the independent investment advisor's report, and the share exchange ratio. This was approved by shareholders representing 85.474% of the outstanding shares.
2- The merger by amalgamation between Arkan Al Kuwait Real Estate Co. (K.S.C.P.) and Al-Oula Real Estate Investment Company (K.S.C.C.) was approved, whereby Arkan Al Kuwait Real Estate Co. (K.S.C.P.) is the merging company, and Al-Oula Real Estate Investment Company (K.S.C.C.) is the merged company. This will be achieved by dissolving Al-Oula Real Estate Investment Company (K.S.C.C.) and transferring its financial liability to Arkan Al Kuwait Real Estate Co. (K.S.C.P.), and issuing shares of Arkan Al Kuwait Real Estate Co. (K.S.C.P.) to be allocated to the shareholders of Al-Oula Real Estate Investment Company (K.S.C.C.) in accordance with the fair exchange ratio of 0.75034000483 shares of Arkan Al Kuwait Real Estate Co. (K.S.C.P.) capital for every 1 (one) share of Al-Oula Real Estate Investment Company (K.S.C.C.). The Board of Directors, or whomever it may assign or delegate, is authorized to implement this resolution in accordance with the relevant laws and regulations. This was approved by shareholders representing 85.474% of the outstanding shares.
3- The continued trading of Arkan Al Kuwait Real Estate Co. (K.S.C.P.) shares on Boursa Kuwait <orig>بورصة الكويت</orig> during and after the implementation of the merger process was approved. This was approved by shareholders representing 85.474% of the outstanding shares.
4- The in-kind increase of the authorized, issued, and paid-up capital of Arkan Al Kuwait Real Estate Co. (K.S.C.P.) by the value of the net assets of the merged company was approved, from 25,114,998.400 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينارا كويتيا</orig> (twenty-five million, one hundred fourteen thousand, nine hundred ninety-eight Dinars and 400 fils), divided into 251,149,984 shares (two hundred fifty-one million, one hundred forty-nine thousand, nine hundred eighty-four shares), to 31,140,087.800 Kuwaiti Dinars (thirty-one million, one hundred forty thousand, eighty-seven Dinars and 800 fils), divided into 311,400,877 shares (three hundred eleven million, four hundred thousand, eight hundred seventy-seven shares), by issuing 60,250,894 shares (sixty million, two hundred fifty thousand, eight hundred ninety-four shares) at a nominal value of 100 fils, without an issuance premium, with the current shareholders of the merging company waiving their pre-emptive rights to subscribe to the new shares, and allocating all the capital increase shares of Arkan Al Kuwait Real Estate Co. (K.S.C.P.) to the shareholders of Al-Oula Real Estate Investment Company (K.S.C.C.). The fair exchange ratio on which the shares will be issued shall be 0.75034000483 shares of Arkan Al Kuwait Real Estate Co. (K.S.C.P.) capital for every 1 (one) share of Al-Oula Real Estate Investment Company (K.S.C.C.). This was approved by shareholders representing 85.474% of the outstanding shares.
5- The timeline for share entitlements was approved, and the Board of Directors of Arkan Al Kuwait Real Estate Co. (K.S.C.P.), or whomever it may assign or delegate, was authorized to amend this timeline if it is not possible to announce the confirmation of the timeline at least eight business days before the entitlement date. This applies in the event of delays in the public notification procedures or approvals from regulatory authorities according to the merger implementation schedule. This was approved by shareholders representing 85.474% of the outstanding shares.

</table>

6- The amendment of Article (6) of the Memorandum of Association and Article (5) of the Articles of Association was approved by shareholders representing 85.474% of the outstanding shares, as follows:

# Al-Oula Real Estate Investment Company K.S.C. Closed <orig>الشركة الأولى للاستثمار العقاري ش.م.ك مقفلة</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting Held on Wednesday, December 25, 2024

The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of Al-Oula Real Estate Investment Company K.S.C. Closed <orig>الشركة الأولى للاستثمار العقاري ش.م.ك مقفلة</orig> held its meeting on Wednesday, December 25, 2024, at 11:00 AM at Al Hamra Business Tower <orig>برج الحمراء التجاري</orig>, located in the Sharq area <orig>منطقة الشرق</orig>, Block 8, Plot 14 <orig>قسيمة 14</orig>, Al-Shuhada Street <orig>شارع الشهداء</orig>, 66th Floor.

In the presence of:
1- Mr. Abdulmohsen Saleh Sulaiman Al-Tukhaim <orig>عبد المحسن صالح سليمان الطخيم</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chairman of the Assembly.
2- Mr. Abdulrahman Abdullah Abdulrahman Al-Wohaibi <orig>عبد الرحمن عبدالله عبد الرحمن الوهيبي</orig>, Chief Executive Officer.
3- Shareholders holding 122,866,988 shares in person and by proxy, representing 80.68% of the total capital of 152,283,580 shares.

After announcing that the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting was met, the Chairman of the Assembly opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees. The items on the agenda were then reviewed and discussed, and the following were approved and ratified:

First: The draft merger agreement, which includes the reports of the asset appraiser and the independent investment advisor regarding the merger by amalgamation between Al-Oula Real Estate Investment Company (K.S.C.C.) (the Merged Company <orig>الشركة المندمجة</orig>) and Arkan Kuwait Real Estate Company (K.S.C.P.) <orig>شركة أركان الكويت العقارية (ش.م.ك.ع)</orig> (the Merging Company <orig>الشركة الدامجة</orig>), was ratified. Approval was given for the fair exchange ratio between the shares of Arkan Kuwait Real Estate Company (K.S.C.P.) and Al-Oula Real Estate Investment Company (K.S.C.C.), which is 0.75034000483, meaning 0.75034000483 new shares of Arkan Kuwait Real Estate Company (K.S.C.P.) for each share of Al-Oula Real Estate Investment Company (K.S.C.C.), with the approval of shareholders representing 80.68% of the outstanding shares.

Second: The merger by amalgamation between Al-Oula Real Estate Investment Company (K.S.C.C.) (the Merged Company <orig>الشركة المندمجة</orig>) and Arkan Kuwait Real Estate Company (K.S.C.P.) (the Merging Company <orig>الشركة الدامجة</orig>) was ratified, and it was resolved to proceed with the implementation of the merger procedures, with the approval of shareholders representing 80.68% of the outstanding shares.

Third: The dissolution of Al-Oula Real Estate Investment Company (K.S.C.C.) was ratified, along with the consequent transfer of its financial rights and obligations to Arkan Kuwait Real Estate Company (K.S.C.P.). The legal personality of the Merged Company shall remain in existence until its shareholders are fully registered in the shareholder register of the Merging Company, after which the legal personality of the Merged Company shall cease to exist upon the completion of the merger procedures, its deregistration, and the cancellation of its licenses from the records of the Department of Shareholding Companies at the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, with the approval of shareholders representing 80.68% of the outstanding shares.

Fourth: Approval was given to authorize the Board of Directors, or whomever it may assign or delegate, to implement the resolutions issued by the Assembly, with the approval of shareholders representing 80.68% of the outstanding shares.

At the end of the meeting, Mr. Abdulmohsen Saleh Sulaiman Al-Tukhaim <orig>عبد المحسن صالح سليمان الطخيم</orig> thanked the attendees, and the proceedings of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting concluded at 11:30 AM on the same day.

Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chairman of the Assembly

# Wafra Holding Company (K.S.C) Closed <orig>شركة وفرة القابضة (ش.م.ك) مقفلة</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting on Sunday, January 19, 2025

The Extraordinary General Assembly of Wafra Holding Company <orig>شركة وفرة القابضة</orig> held its meeting on Sunday, January 19, 2025, at 11:00 AM in the meeting hall at the company's headquarters, 360 Mall – Fourth Floor, chaired by Mr. Salah Abdulaziz Al-Bahar <orig>صلاح عبدالعزيز البحر</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors. The Chairman of the session opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees and announcing the presence of shareholders holding 250,000,000 shares by proxy, representing an attendance rate of 100% of the total company shares, and called for the discussion of the agenda items.

### *Amendment of Article (5) of the Memorandum of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and Article (4) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
**1. Text before amendment:**
1. Owning shares in Kuwaiti or foreign shareholding companies, as well as owning shares or stakes in Kuwaiti or foreign limited liability companies, or participating in the establishment, management, lending to, and guaranteeing of these companies of both types.
2. Lending to companies in which it owns shares and guaranteeing them with third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than 20%.
3. Owning industrial property rights such as patents, industrial trademarks, industrial designs, or any other related rights, and leasing them to other companies for their use, whether inside or outside Kuwait.
4. Owning the movable and real estate properties necessary to conduct its activities within the limits permitted by law.
5. Utilizing the company's available financial surpluses by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities.
6. Managing subsidiary companies or participating in the management of other companies in which it contributes and providing the necessary support to them.

The company shall have the right to conduct the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either directly or through an agent. The company may have an interest in or associate in any way with entities that engage in activities similar to its own or that may assist it in achieving its objectives in Kuwait or abroad, and it may establish, participate in, purchase, or affiliate with such entities.

## Announcement
### Issuance of Tender No. M M / 54 / 2024-2025
The Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the issuance of a public tender under No. M M 54 for the year 2024/2025 for the supply, installation, operation, maintenance, and warranty of protection devices for the educational districts and schools network (Area and school firewall), and the provision of technical support and training for the needs of the Information Systems Department. All work subject to the tender is to be executed in accordance with the general and special conditions, technical specifications, and schedules of items, numbers, quantities, and prices within the period specified in the tender documents, and generally in accordance with all provisions contained in the tender documents and the contract to be concluded based on them.

### General Instructions for Bidders:
1. The tender is (public) for bidders accredited by the Ministry of Education to carry out the work subject to the tender.
2. It is required that any applicant for this tender be a specialized company/institution (within Kuwait) in carrying out all the work subject to the tender, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry for the current year. The applying companies must have prior experience in this field and possess the capabilities and a specialized, trained technical workforce to execute the work subject to the tender.
3. This tender is indivisible and pertains to the execution of all work subject to the tender in accordance with the general and special conditions, technical specifications, and schedules of items, numbers, quantities, and prices. The bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers (bids), as the tender documents do not permit the submission of alternative offers (bids). Therefore, the bidder must adhere to what is stated in the documents of this tender in this regard.
4. The bidder must submit with their bid a preliminary deposit in the amount of KWD 2,000 (two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only) in the form of a certified check or an unconditional, irrevocable, and reservation-free letter of guarantee issued by one of the accredited banks in the State of Kuwait in their name and for the benefit of the Ministry of Education. This deposit must be valid for the duration of the bid's validity. Any bid not accompanied by this full deposit will be excluded. Preliminary deposits shall not be returned until after the passage of (90) days from the tender closing date or when the winning bidder submits the final deposit and signs the contract, unless the tender is canceled. The Ministry of Education will not pay any interest on the amount of this deposit, and the bidder's creditors may not seize this amount.
5. The total duration of the contract is (36 months), during which the contractor is obligated to execute all work subject to the tender in accordance with the general and special conditions, technical specifications, and the schedule of items, numbers, quantities, and prices, according to the general and special conditions, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the tender documents.
6. The bid shall remain in effect and irrevocable from the time of its submission for a period of (90 days) from the date of opening the bid envelopes. No price adjustments will be considered after the bid has been submitted. If it is not possible to decide on the bids within the specified validity period, bidders will be asked to accept the extension of their bids' validity for another similar period at most. Each bidder must agree in writing to the extension, specifying the duration of the preliminary deposit, and the bid of anyone who does not accept the extension of its validity period will be excluded.
7. If, upon studying the tender, the bidder finds any error, omission, or discrepancy in the technical documents or the schedule of quantities that may affect the categories of their bid or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education before submitting their bid. The Ministry will study these observations and inquiries if they are serious and will answer them during the preliminary meeting, correcting any error, omission, discrepancy, or conflict (if any), or will circulate the clarification and response by means of a letter addressed to every bidder who purchased the tender documents. The response in this case shall be considered an integral part of those tender documents. In all cases, this shall not result in any additional responsibility or obligation on the part of the Ministry.
8. Bids shall be deposited in the designated box at the headquarters of the Supplies and Warehouses Department (in the South Subhan <orig>صبحان الجنوبي</orig> area) during official working hours, no later than 15 working days. No bid received after the said deadline will be considered, nor will any change, modification, or reduction in the prices of the submitted bids received after the bid has been submitted.
9. The fee for obtaining a copy of the tender documents is (KWD 75).
10. A preliminary meeting will be held to answer the inquiries of the bidders on the Sunday following the publication of the announcement in the Kuwait Today <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> newspaper at 10:00 AM at the headquarters of the Supplies and Warehouses Department (in the South Subhan <orig>صبحان الجنوبي</orig> area).
11. The bidder must fill out the attached schedules and provide a statement of all

# Minutes of the Births and Deaths Committee Meeting No. 2025/01, held on 07/01/2025

After reviewing the applications submitted for the amendment of data in the birth and death records, the Committee has decided to announce the amendments listed below in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>). If the Committee receives no objection within fifteen days from the date of this announcement's publication, the amendment will be made in the records, and birth or death certificates will be issued in accordance with the following amendment:

# Minutes of the Births and Deaths Committee Meeting held on 07/01/2025, Committee 01/2025

The Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig>, stipulated in Article 15 of Law No. 36 of 1969 and formed by Ministerial Decree No. 1650 of 2021, has convened.

<table>
| | |
|:---|:---|
| Mr. / Director of the Central Registry for Births and Deaths Administration <orig>مدير إدارة السجل المركزي للمواليد والوفيات</orig> | Chairman |
| Dr. / Head of the General Medical Council <orig>رئيس المجلس الطبي العام</orig> | Member |
| Mr. / Head of the Research and Opinion Department <orig>رئيس قسم البحوث والرأي</orig> | Member |
| Mr. / Head of the Registration Department <orig>رئيس قسم القيد</orig> | Member |
| Mr. / Head of the Deaths Department <orig>رئيس قسم الوفيات</orig> | Member |
| Mr. / Legal Researcher <orig>الباحث القانوني</orig> | Member |
| Mr. / Head of the Records Department <orig>رئيس قسم السجلات</orig> | Member |
</table>

The committee's secretarial duties were performed by Mrs. Shukriya Al-Durai'e <orig>شكرية الدريعي</orig>.

The Committee reviewed applications from No. ((01)) to No. ((17)) in the attached list, concerning the amendment of data in the birth and death records for requests of late registration of birth and death. After examination and verification of the fulfillment of documents and records, the Committee decides to announce the amendments and requests in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) for two consecutive issues. If the legal period (fifteen days) from the date of the last announcement elapses without any objection being submitted, the amendments will be made in the registers, and the birth and death certificates will be issued.

Against:
1- Haitham Abbas Yaqoub Al-Arian <orig>هيثم عباس يعقوب العريان</orig>.
2- Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>.

First: Property Description: According to the attached description certificate.
- Property under Document No. 2017/6231, located in the Al-Khiran <orig>الخيران</orig> area – Plot 378 <orig>قسيمة ٣٧٨</orig> – Block 7 <orig>قطعة ٧</orig> – from Plan No. M/35404 – with an area of 600 m².
* Note:
- There are major violations on the roof with an area of 9 m², violation report No. 12697 dated 2/5/2024.
* Inspection:
The property in dispute is located in the new Al-Khiran <orig>الخيران</orig> residential area, Block (7) – Street (720) – House (12), Plot (378), Automated No.: 21124504, under Document No. 2017/6231, with an area of 600 m². The inspection was conducted in the presence and with the guidance of the defendant and Mr. Saad Al-Mutairi <orig>سعد المطيري</orig>, the expert consultant retained by the Administration, while the plaintiff was absent. The inspection was carried out as follows:
- The property subject of the lawsuit is a newly constructed private residence located on one street and an alleyway, consisting of three floors with Sigma-clad facades, central air conditioning, and an elevator.
- The ground floor consists of: a diwaniya with its bathroom, a living room, 4 bedrooms, a kitchen, and a maid's room with its bathroom. It is occupied.
- The first floor consists of: a living room, 6 bedrooms, 5 bathrooms, and a kitchen. It is unoccupied.
- The second floor consists of two apartments (Apartment No. 1 consists of a living room, kitchen, 3 bedrooms, and 3 bathrooms) and (Apartment No. 2 consists of a living room, kitchen, 4 bedrooms, and 4 bathrooms). It is unoccupied.
- The expert consultant, Mr. Saad Al-Mutairi <orig>سعد المطيري</orig>, took all his notes in preparation for appraising the property's value.

Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall start at a base price of KWD 234,000 (two hundred thirty-four thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). To participate in the auction, a payment of at least one-fifth of this price is required, either by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session offering to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction will be immediately reopened at their liability based on the price at which it was previously awarded to them. In this session, no bid will be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for title transfer and registration, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request and responsibility of those initiating the sale procedures. The Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> shall bear no liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges having inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states: "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to issue a lease contract in their favor for a comparable rent."
President of the Court of First Instance <orig>رئيس المحكمة الكلية</orig>

* The expert appraisal took place during a session on 14/4/2024, proceeding to inspect the property in question located in the Fintas <orig>الفنطاس</orig> area, Block (5), Salem Sabah Al-Salem Street, Plot No. (15). According to the Civil ID program (Kuwait Finder), it bears Plot No. (800004) – PACI No. for the address 90884865. This was conducted in the presence of Mr. Adel Al-Aslawi <orig>عادل العسلاوي</orig>, the appointed expert, and under the guidance of the plaintiff bank's agent. The first and second defendants, or their legal representatives, failed to attend despite being properly notified. The inspection was carried out as follows:-
1. The property is a vacant plot of land, fenced from the outside with Kirby panels, directly overlooking the sea with a frontage of 61 linear meters + a rear access way separating it from the Al-Safeer Hotel + a side yard.
2. The total area of the property is (4762 m²) according to Property Document No. 2009/4841 attached to the case file.
3. During the inspection, it was found that the main gates are closed, and there is an open wooden side door. It was observed that the plot's land had been previously excavated and the walls reinforced, with water flooding the plot and construction work having been halted for a long time.
Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the base price set for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is accepted by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full accepted price, plus expenses and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was accepted does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session who is willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction shall be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction shall be immediately reopened at their liability, based on the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this new session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for title transfer and registration, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those initiating the sale procedures, and under their responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease agreement in their favor for a comparable rent."
Important Note:
All companies and sole proprietorships are prohibited from participating in auctions for plots or houses designated for private housing purposes, in accordance with the provisions of Article 230 of the Commercial Companies Law, as added by Law No. 9 of 2008.
President of the Court of First Instance

** And according to the expert's report
- The subject of the dispute is located in the Al-Firdous <orig>الفردوس</orig> area, Block 5, Street 1, Avenue 7, Plot 144, with an area of 300 m2. It consists of 3 floors, is located on a corner lot with a setback, facing Sabah Al-Nasser <orig>صباح الناصر</orig>. The air conditioning is unit-based. Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction begins at the base price indicated for the property. To participate in the auction, a deposit of at least one-fifth of that price is required, payable by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Execution Department at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding is reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the execution procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request and responsibility of those initiating the sale procedures. The Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bears no liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draft a lease contract in their favor for a similar rent."

# Descriptions of the First Property:
1- The entire property of Document No. 2017/9568, for which Title Deed No. 2020/7108 was issued, located in the Al-Jabriya <orig>الجابرية</orig> area - Plot No. 460 <orig>قسيمة رقم 460</orig> - Block No. 6 <orig>قطعة رقم 6</orig> - Plan M/33879 - with an area of 375 m², to be sold at public auction <orig>بالمزاد العلني</orig> with a base price of KWD 568,620 (Five hundred sixty-eight thousand, six hundred and twenty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينارا كويتيا</orig>).
- According to the description certificate.
- The property is a private residence consisting of a basement, ground floor, first floor, second floor, and a roof. There are violations on the property, which are construction additions on the ground floor and the roof.
- **According to the expert's report**
- The property in dispute is located in the Al-Jabriya <orig>الجابرية</orig> area, Block 6, Hamad bin Mubarak Al-Manaei Street, Plot 460, House 20.
- The property in dispute is a house overlooking one main street with three neighbors. Its facades are clad in black and beige stone, with an area of 375 square meters.
- The property in dispute consists of the following:
- Basement: A hall, four rooms, three bathrooms, a laundry room, and a maid's room with its bathroom.
- Ground Floor: A hall, four rooms, four bathrooms, a kitchen, a laundry room, and a maid's room with its bathroom.
- First Floor: The door to the first floor is closed. The plaintiff's representative claimed that the first floor is similar to the second floor.
- Second Floor: A hall, four rooms, four bathrooms, a kitchen, a laundry room, and a maid's room with its bathroom.
- Third Floor: A hall, three rooms, four bathrooms, a laundry room, a maid's room with its bathroom, and a boiler room without equipment.
- The property in dispute has central air conditioning and an elevator.
- The expert assessment found that the property in dispute requires some finishing touches, such as electrical outlets, interior and exterior lighting, and some minor finishes in certain parts, as the property is a new construction and electricity has not yet been connected.

# Descriptions of the Second Property:
- The entire property of Document No. 2014/601, for which Title Deed No. 2021/2301 was issued, located in the Al-Mahboula <orig>المهبولة</orig> area - Plot No. 218 <orig>قسيمة رقم 218</orig> - Block No. 5 <orig>قطعة رقم 5</orig> - Plan M/33966 - with an area of 800 m², to be sold at public auction <orig>بالمزاد العلني</orig> with a base price of KWD 2,106,000 (Two million, one hundred and six thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
- According to the description certificate.
- The property was found to be an investment residence consisting of a shop + ground floor + 15 repeated floors + a roof. The owner has committed several violations.
- Construction of an illegal external wall obstructing vehicle entry + relocation of the swimming pool, which led to the cancellation of parking spaces from numbers 86, and an unlicensed construction on the ground floor with an area of 35 m².
- Violation of enclosing all lightwells on the repeated floors, with a total area of 69 m².
- Illegal expansion and construction on all repeated floors, with an area of 580 m².
- **According to the expert's report**
- The property in dispute is located in the Al-Mahboula <orig>المهبولة</orig> area, Block 2 (currently), main street No. 20 and internal street No. 226, Plot 218, where the inspection was conducted as follows:
- The property in dispute is a building overlooking a main street, an internal street, and a side alley. Its facades are clad with Sigma, and it has an area of 800 square meters.
- The property in dispute consists of the following:
- Ground Floor: A reception hall, a health club, a guard's room, a swimming pool in the yard, and a shop overlooking the main street (a grocery store).
- First Floor to Fifteenth Floor: Each floor consists of two apartments. The first apartment consists of a hall, two rooms, three bathrooms, a kitchen, and a balcony. The second apartment consists of a hall, two rooms, three bathrooms, a kitchen, a maid's room with its bathroom, and a balcony.
- Sixteenth Floor: Consists of two rooms, two bathrooms, two kitchens, and a roof.
- The property in dispute has central air conditioning and two elevators. The apartments are furnished but not occupied.

5. ## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall commence at the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in this session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction will be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction shall be immediately reopened at their liability, based on the price at which it was previously awarded to them. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law. The parties initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

### Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedure Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedure Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedure Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states: "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to execute a lease agreement in their favor for a comparable rent."

## Property Description: (According to the attached Description Certificate)
- Property of Document No. 17580/1994 located in the Al-Waha <orig>الواحة</orig> area - Plot No. 928 <orig>قسيمة رقم 928</orig> - Block No. 2 <orig>قطعة رقم 2</orig> - from Plan No. M/36877 - with an area of 300 m², to be sold by public auction with a base price of (157,500 K.D.) (One hundred fifty-seven thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
**And according to what is stated in the Description Certificate:
- There is a violation consisting of a room with a Kirby roof, with an area of 106 m².
**And according to what is stated in the attached expert's report:
- On 26/10/2020, we proceeded to the disputed property located in the Al-Waha <orig>الواحة</orig> area, Block 2, Street 6, Plot 928, and the inspection was carried out as follows:
1- The disputed property conforms in its general and specific specifications to Document No. (17580/94), with an area of 300 m², pursuant to a sales contract issued by the Government of Kuwait and submitted in the plaintiff's document file dated 24/9/2020.
2- The disputed property is a private residence located on one street with an alleyway at the back, and has neighbors on the right and left. It consists of two and a half floors and a yard (Housh <orig>حوش</orig>) with a diwaniya <orig>ديوانيه</orig> at the front and an annex at the back. It has two entrances, one at the front and one at the back.
3- The exterior of the property is clad in brick, and the air conditioning is of the window unit type.
4- The disputed property consists of two and a half floors and a yard, detailed as follows:
- Ground Floor: Consists of 3 rooms, a bathroom, and a kitchen.
- First Floor: Consists of 3 rooms, a bathroom, and a kitchen. Its entrance is from the rear via a staircase at the back entrance of the property.
- Second Floor: This is a half-floor. The expert was able to inspect one room at its entrance, but there is a locked door leading to the rest of the floor, which the expert could not inspect. The entrance to this floor is from the adjacent property, which is Plot No. 929.
- The yard (Housh <orig>حوش</orig>) has a diwaniya <orig>ديوانيه</orig> at the front entrance and an annex at the back entrance. The annex consists of two rooms, a bathroom, and a kitchen. The seventh defendant from the first party stated that the annex is occupied by a tenant who does not pay rent.
5- Upon our inquiry about the components of the second floor, the seventh defendant from the first party stated that it consists of one room and is not used by anyone. He also stated that the first floor of the building is used by the third defendant from the first party, Mr. / Mohammed Owaid Al-Antari <orig>محمد عويد العنتري</orig>.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the base price listed for the property. To participate in the auction, a payment of at least one-fifth of that price is required, either by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is accepted by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full accepted price, in addition to expenses and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was accepted does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding is reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their liability, based on the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those initiating the sale procedures, and at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

## First: Property Description:
- The property of Document No. 11608/2000 is located in the Al-Salam <orig>السلام</orig> area – Plot No. 589 – Block No. 5 – from Plan No. M/32905 – with an area of 484.5 m² – for the sum of KWD 451,980 (four hundred fifty-one thousand, nine hundred and eighty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينارا كويتيا</orig>).
- According to the description certificate,
The property is a private residence consisting of a ground floor + first floor + part of the second floor.
- And according to the expert's report.
- The property is located in the suburb of Al-Salam <orig>السلام</orig>, Block 5 – Street 521, 510 – House 5.
- The disputed property is a private residential house of average construction, located on two streets (front and back), one of which is a main internal street, and is clad with Sigma.
- The property consists of a ground floor + first floor + quarter floor.
- The ground floor consists of: 2 halls + washbasins and a bathroom + 2 master bedrooms with bathrooms + a main kitchen + a driver's room with a bathroom + a small courtyard.
- The first floor consists of: a hall + a master bedroom with a dressing room and bathroom + a master bedroom with a bathroom + a room + a bathroom + a preparatory kitchen.
- The quarter floor consists of: a laundry room + a maid's room with a bathroom + the remainder is a rooftop.
- The unit is in normal condition and the air conditioning is central.
- The ground floor is unoccupied and unfurnished at the time of inspection, as the third defendant stated that it is not currently occupied by anyone.
- The first floor is occupied by the third defendant.
- It was determined by the expert that it is not feasible to sort and partition the property among the parties to the lawsuit based on the smallest share, as this conflicts with the regulations in force in the State of Kuwait and because it would cause a significant decrease in the property's value.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the base price set for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in this session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction will be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with the ten percent increase, the auction will be immediately reopened at their liability on the basis of the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

### Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to issue a lease contract in their favor for a similar rent."

**President of the Court of First Instance**

Against:
Mona Mahmoud Abdulnabi Al-Shirazi <orig>منى محمود عبدالنبي الشيرازي</orig>.

## First: Property Description:
An undivided share of 50% in the property of Document No. 2014/3321, located in the Surra area, Plot No. 716, Block No. 4, from Plan No. M/32994, with a total area of 512 m², for the amount of KWD 256,500 (two hundred fifty-six thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) for the offered share.
According to what is stated in the description certificate,
The property is a private residence consisting of a ground floor + first floor + part of a second floor + rooftop, and there is a violation, which is the construction of a room on the rooftop without a license, with a Kirby roof.
And according to what is stated in the expert's report,
The property subject of the lawsuit conforms in terms of general and specific specifications to Document No. 2014/3321 and has an area of 512 m².

## General Description of the Disputed Property
The disputed property is a private residence in good condition. It is located on a single internal street, is bordered by a neighbor on both sides, and has an alleyway at the back with a separate canopy for parking 2 cars, and has a front setback.
It is used as a parking area sufficient for 5 cars and is shaded by a canopy. Its exterior cladding is reddish-beige Tabra stone. It consists of three floors (basement, ground, and first) and a sunken courtyard.

## Components of the Disputed Property:
The basement floor consists of: a hall overlooking the sunken courtyard, 2 rooms, an external bathroom, a preparatory kitchen, and a marble counter.
The ground floor consists of: two interconnected reception halls, 2 rooms, 2 bathrooms, and a main kitchen.
The first floor consists of: a hall, 3 rooms, 2 bathrooms, 1 master bedroom with its bathroom, and a separate ceramic counter serving as a preparatory kitchen.
The rooftop consists of: one room with its bathroom, made of Kirby, for the servant.
The sunken courtyard has 2 staircases, the first leading to the front facade and the second leading to the back alleyway.

## Details of the Disputed Property:
The house generally has a modern finishing level according to the following details: The air conditioning is central, except for the servant's room on the rooftop, which is equipped with window units, and all rooms on the first floor are equipped with window units in addition to the central AC. The flooring is marble, and the courtyard is tiled. The ceiling is gypsum decor, the interior walls are plain paint, the lighting is spotlights, the doors are wood, and the windows are aluminum.

## Nature of Use of the Disputed Property:
It was found by the expert that the disputed property is used as a private residence for the plaintiff and his children, and it was found that it is not rented and generates no income.
The expert did not find the defendant to be present at the disputed property.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the base price associated with the property. To participate in the auction, a payment of at least one-fifth of that price is required by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding is reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their liability on the basis of the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session shall be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The winning bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, the legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The winning bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

### Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.

The expert and the due diligence expert inspected apartment number (3), which is owned by the plaintiff and the fourth defendant in equal shares (5% each), totaling 10% of the total property value, according to the plaintiff's statement. The apartment consists of a hall, a master bedroom with its own bathroom, two rooms with a shared bathroom, a guest bathroom, a kitchen, and a maid's room with its own bathroom. The apartment's flooring is finished with ceramic tiles.
The expert was unable to inspect the remaining apartments on this floor due to being denied access.
3- The first floor consists of 3 identical apartments in terms of the number of rooms, halls, bathrooms, and kitchens, according to the plaintiff's statement. The expert inspected apartment number (5), owned by the second defendant, which consists of a hall, a master bedroom with its own bathroom, two rooms with a shared bathroom, a kitchen, and a maid's room with a kitchen. The expert was unable to inspect the rest of the apartments due to being denied access.
4- The second floor consists of 3 identical apartments in terms of the number of rooms, halls, bathrooms, and kitchens, according to the plaintiff's statement, which the expert was unable to inspect due to being denied access.
5- The rooftop of the property in dispute consists of the stairwell, the elevator, air conditioning units, and rooms made of Kirby, which were constructed by the property's residents, according to the plaintiff's statement, as the expert was not enabled to inspect the rooftop.
- The exterior cladding of the property subject to the lawsuit is Sigma.
- The air conditioning for the property in dispute is central air conditioning.
- The property has an electric elevator.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the base price listed for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale had been awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction will be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with the ten percent increase, the auction shall be immediately reopened at their liability on the basis of the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session shall be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for title transfer and registration, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those initiating the sale procedures, and at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states: "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draft a lease agreement in their favor for a comparable rent."

# Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>
## Announcement of a Sealed-Bid Auction
## Auction No. (2440)
The Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> announces the sale of chalets of various sizes and their accessories - lighting - umbrellas, through a sealed-bid auction at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> according to the following details: -
1- Location for receiving the terms booklet and auction participation offer: Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> – Central Archives and Files Section – Financial Affairs, from 26/1/2025 until 29/1/2025. The documents will be provided for a non-refundable fee of (50) K.D. to be paid via K-net at the Ministry of Health's <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> cashier.
Upon receiving the terms booklet, the bidder will sign a declaration and pledge to adhere to the specified appointment for submitting the offer to the Central Sales Committee at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>.
2- Inspection Date: (2) two working days, from 3/2/2025 until 4/2/2025.
Inspection Time: During official working hours.
3- Location for receiving those wishing to inspect the auction items: Al-Abdali Health Center <orig>مركز العبدلي الصحي</orig>.
Date of Bid Submission and Envelope Opening:
- Bid submission on Sunday, 9/2/2025, at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Ministries Complex – Block 12 – Third Floor – General Warehousing Affairs Department – Central Sales Section, according to the appointment set for the bidder by the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> (No offer will be accepted after the bidder's specified appointment time has passed).
- Envelope opening and auction holding on Monday, 10/2/2025, at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Ministries Complex – Block 12 – Third Floor – General Warehousing Affairs Department.
- The winning bidder will be announced on the Ministry of Finance's <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> website on Monday, 10/2/2025.
- Checks will be returned to the unsuccessful bidders on Tuesday, 11/2/2025.
- The certified check / bank guarantee shall be submitted in the name of the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.
- Special Conditions for the Auction:
1. The bidder must be Kuwaiti – an individual or a company – registered in the Commercial Register and with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>. A foreigner may participate provided they have a Kuwaiti partner or a commercial agent under a notarized contract. (Must attach: a copy of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry certificate, a copy of the company license, a copy of the Civil ID, and an authorization letter certified by the Chamber of Commerce and Industry, all of which must be valid).
2. Kuwaiti individuals are permitted to participate in the auction (a copy of the Civil ID must be attached).
3. The winning bidder must remove the concrete foundations.
To receive the auction terms booklet: Please contact Ms. Zainab Agha <orig>زينب أغا</orig>, Tel: 24622342
Inspection Site Officer: Please contact Mr. Thani Saad Thani Al-Anzi <orig>ثاني سعد ثاني العنزي</orig>, Tel: 65564449.
Central Sales Committee at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> / Tel: (22481971).
Website address: www.mof.gov.kw
Undersecretary of the Ministry of Finance <orig>وكيل وزارة المالية</orig>

# Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>
## Announcement
The Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> announces that the Allocation Committee, in its meeting No. (6/2024) held on 12/12/2024, decided to reject the grievance submitted by Mrs. Noura Saad Al-Qahtani <orig>نورة سعد القحطاني</orig> regarding the cancellation of the craft license and the withdrawal of craft unit No. (M17/M18) in the Fahaheel Craft Complex <orig>مجمع الفحيحيل الحرفي</orig> for violating the nationalization conditions.
The concerned party must vacate the craft unit within 10 days from the date of this announcement and hand it over to the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>. Otherwise, the Authority will be forced to take removal measures at the expense of the concerned party, without prejudice to the Authority's right to claim any other compensation that may result from this.

## Announcement
The Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> announces that the Allocation Committee, in its meeting No. (6/2024) held on 12/12/2024, decided to withdraw the sand quarry (darkal) allocated to M/s. United Gulf Construction Company <orig>شركة الخليج المتحدة للإنشاء</orig>, located in the Subiya Darkeel <orig>الصبية الدراكيل</orig> area.
Based on Ministerial Resolution No. (4/2018) concerning the rules and regulations for the temporary allocation of sand quarry sites (sand darkeels),
The concerned parties are requested to clear the darkal of machinery and equipment, rehabilitate the site in accordance with the requirements of the Environment Public Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للبيئة</orig> in this regard, and hand over the darkal to the Authority. Otherwise, the Authority will be forced to take administrative removal measures and rehabilitate the site at your expense, deducted from the bank guarantee provided for this purpose, without prejudice to the Authority's right to claim any other compensation that may result from this from the concerned party.

P.P. 17 – 2024/2025
Regarding the purchase of software licenses for
Digital Risk Protection with ASM
License for 2 years

The Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> announces the issuance of a sealed-envelope tender regarding the purchase of software licenses for Digital Risk Protection with ASM License for 2 years in the booklet:
1. These documents can be obtained from the Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشئون المالية</orig> – Cashier Section (South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig> – Ministries Area – Ground Floor) during official working hours for a fee not exceeding 50 K.D. (only fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
2. The deadline for submitting bids to the Financial Affairs Department is 12:00 PM on Sunday, 02/02/2025. Any bid submitted after this deadline will be rejected.
3. The initial bid bond amount must not be less than 2% (two percent) of the tender bid value. The bond must be issued in Arabic by an approved local bank and remain valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity.
4. The final performance bond amount is 10% (ten percent) of the total contract value, and this bond must be issued in Arabic by an approved local bank.
5. The bid shall remain valid for a period of 90 days (ninety days) from the date of opening the bid envelopes.
6. Alternative offers will not be accepted.
7. The tender is not divisible.

Acting Deputy Director General for Administrative and Financial Affairs <orig>نائب المدير العام للشؤون الإدارية والمالية بالتكليف</orig>

# Tender Announcement
## No.: P.A.C.I. 29 – 2024/2025
### Regarding the Purchase of Software Packages for the Development of Kuwait Finder
### Procurement of Software Packages for Kuwait Finder

The Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> announces a tender by sealed envelope for the purchase of software packages for the development of Kuwait Finder
Procurement of Software Packages for Kuwait Finder in the booklet:

1. These documents can be obtained from the Financial Affairs Department – Cashier Section (South Surra – Ministries Area – Ground Floor) during official working hours for a fee of K.D. 50/- (only fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
2. The deadline for submitting bids to the Financial Affairs Department is 12:00 PM on Sunday, 02/02/2025. Any bid submitted after this deadline will be rejected.
3. The initial bid bond amount must be no less than 2% (two percent) of the tender's bid value. The bond must be issued by an approved local bank in the Arabic language and remain valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity.
4. The final performance bond amount is 10% (ten percent) of the total contract value. This bond must be issued by an approved local bank in the Arabic language.
5. The bid shall remain valid for a period of 90 days (ninety days) from the date of opening the bid envelopes.
6. Alternative offers will not be accepted.
7. The tender is indivisible.

Acting Deputy Director General for Administrative and Financial Affairs

# Announcement
The Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> announces that the individuals listed below have had their residential addresses canceled in its records (based on a declaration by the property owner or due to the demolition of the building). These individuals are required to visit the Authority to register their new address (after providing supporting documents) within thirty days from this date. Failure to do so will result in the penalty stipulated in Article (33) of Law No. 32 of 1982, which is a fine not exceeding one hundred dinars, multiplied by the number of persons.

## Announcement
### Tender No. (T4-15-2024/2025)
### Development, Operation, and Maintenance of Car Parking and Valet Parking Services at Terminal 4 of Kuwait International Airport

The Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> announces the extension of the closing period for Tender No. (T4-15-2024/2025) for the Development, Operation, and Maintenance of Car Parking and Valet Parking Services at Terminal 4 of Kuwait International Airport. Please be advised that the new deadline for submitting bids will be at 1:00 PM on Sunday, 9/2/2025, instead of Sunday, 26/1/2025.
Any bid submitted after this date will be rejected.

## Announcement
### Tender No. (T4-16-2024/2025)
### Baggage Handling Services at Terminal 4 of Kuwait International Airport

The Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> announces the extension of the closing period for Tender No. (T4-16-2024/2025) for Baggage Handling Services at Terminal 4 of Kuwait International Airport. Please be advised that the new deadline for submitting bids will be at 1:00 PM on Monday, 10/2/2025, instead of Monday, 27/1/2025.

The Kuwait Authority for Partnership Projects <orig>هيئة مشروعات الشراكة بين القطاعين العام والخاص</orig>, in cooperation with the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, announces the extension of the final deadline for purchasing and submitting bids to March 3, 2025, at 12:00 PM instead of February 2, 2025.

## Announcement for Extension of Bid Submission Deadline for Request for Proposal (RFP) for the Transaction Advisory Services of the Kuwait Motor Auction and Auto Showroom Project

### in Accordance with the Central Agency for Public Tenders Law No. (49) of 2016 and its Executive Regulations Issued by Decree No. (30) of 2017

The Kuwait Authority for Partnership Projects ("KAPP"), in collaboration with the Ministry of Commerce and Industry ("MOCI"), announced in the Official Gazette (issue number 1715) on December 1, 2024, an invitation for local, regional, and international transaction advisors/consortiums to submit both technical and financial proposals for providing Transaction Advisory Services related to the preparation of a feasibility study and the procurement of the "Kuwait Motor Auction and Auto Showroom" project (the "Project"). The Project is in accordance with Law No. 116 of 2014 regarding Public Private Partnerships ("PPP Law") and its Executive Regulations.

In accordance to the companies/consortium request to extend the bid's submission date, and since KAPP is keen to assure enough and adequate time for all companies to prepare and submit the technical and financial bids. Therefore, KAPP, in collaboration with MOCI would like to announce the extension of the deadline for submission of proposals to be on March 3, 2025 at 12:00 PM instead of the previously stated deadline of February 2, 2025.
